titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Russian Artillery Commission in North America Records TAM.026
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Tamiment staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29T16:54-0400

did.unittitle: Russian Artillery Commission in North America Records
did.abstract: The Russian Artillery Commission was based in New York; its mission was to negotiate purchase of munitions and other artillery supplies for the Imperial Russian government. The records include correspondence with U.S. and Canadian firms discussing manufacturing specifications and equipment, production estimates, inspection procedures, and order arrangements. Also includes reports and notes of Ordnance Colonel V. Nekrasov and other papers. The records are mostly in Russian.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Russian Artillery Commission in North America.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Material is very fragile; open for research by special arrangement with archives staff only.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Russian Artillery Commission was based in New York; its mission was to negotiate the purchase of munitions and other artillery supplies for the Imperial Russian government.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records include correspondence with U.S. and Canadian firms discussing manufacturing specifications and equipment, production estimates, inspection procedures, and order arrangements. Also includes reports and notes of Ordnance Colonel V. Nekrasov and other papers. Chiefly in Russian.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The box is in original order; folders are not numbered.
The files are grouped into 1 series:

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:

New York, NY 10012

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number;

70 Washington Square South

Reports of ordnance engineer (Title on cover in Russian translates as "Material for a History of the Russian Supply Committee in North America.")
Protocols of meetings of the Commission held at the Russian Technical Bureau in New York (Title on cover reads: "Protocols, 1915-1916, and notes of protocols, 1916-1917.")
Reports of Ordnance Engineer, Col. V. Nekrasov, and his correspondence with American manufacturing firms (Title on cover translates as "My Reports and Correspondence.")
